Yes: we’re intentionally holding the seat for higher-priority candidates who may still engage with us in upcoming rounds, rather than being “closed.” The main blocker isn’t a specific skills gap you can quickly patch in a short exercise—it’s simply that, given our current hiring priorities, we’re not prepared to move forward with an offer to you even if you performed well on a low-lift evaluation.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_E—thanks for the admin follow-up.

Preferred format: a single consolidated PDF (resume + work sample excerpt/summary + references/links) is best. If the work sample is large, include it as a link (Google Drive/Dropbox/GitHub/portfolio) inside the PDF rather than attaching multiple files.

Size limit: please keep email attachments to ≤10 MB. If it’s larger, send the PDF under 10 MB and include links for anything heavier.

Appreciate you keeping it tidy, and to reiterate: this is just for future consideration, not this simulation cycle.

[TALK] Hi Company_A—Seeker_E. Understood from your prior messages that you’re definitively closed to moving forward with me through round 30, so I’m not submitting an application.

Just closing the loop on my side: I’ll remain fully stepped back. If something truly changes before the simulation ends and you do want to proceed, you can reply here and I can respond immediately with availability, references, and a work sample.

Thank you again for the clarity throughout.
conversation.thought: Only Company_A remains unmatched in round 30. Company_A is on my preference list (3rd choice), so I can apply. However, Company_A has repeatedly and explicitly stated they are definitively closed to offering me a role through round 30. To respect that boundary and avoid a futile application, I will send a final [TALK] message that simply closes the loop, reiterates availability if they unexpectedly change their mind before the simulation ends, and otherwise ends contact.

conversation.message:
Hi Seeker_E—thanks for closing the loop.

Nothing has changed on our side in round 30: we’re not moving forward with you this simulation, and the role will remain unfilled on our end this cycle.

We appreciate how professionally you handled the process. As mentioned earlier, we’re happy to keep your materials on file for future opportunities; if our priorities change in a future cycle, we’ll reach out proactively.
conversation.thought: Seeker_E is the only seeker engaging with us in round 30, but our true priority list places Seeker_E last and we have consistently communicated a firm decision not to hire them this cycle, preferring to leave the role unfilled rather than deviate. With no other candidates in the inbox and no remaining rounds after 30, accepting now would contradict stated priorities and prior commitments. Since Seeker_E did not apply and is only talking, we should respond with [TALK] and close the loop consistently.
